result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pearion Dayquintis Holt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Pearion Dayquintis Holt.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Defense advises of pending resolution with the State and requests adjourned plea and sentencing date be set.  Counsel to file plea documents at least 3 days prior to next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson for Arial Rosenberg in court for Pearion Dayquintis Holt.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received the body cam from the State as previously order and requests a projected guilty plea date be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 6/23/2022 (16 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received some discovery and an offer from the State.  Court sets 8/22/2022 deadline for State turnover digitial/body cam evidence.
Court sets this for Adjourned Scheduling conference. Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense moves to dismiss Count 1; denied. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Beckett.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-10-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Pearion Dayquintis Holt in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pearion Dayquintis Holt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
